intro: Tephrosia subaphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, lens-shaped pods. Tephrosia subaphylla is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including savannas and woodland edges.
